This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-27T10:39:05Z Simcock, Neil (simcocn1) 2015-02-27T10:39:01+00:00 2015-02-27T10:39:01+00:00 Final reminder: CFP for Journal Special Issue - Social Justice, Mobility & Energy Demand\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;53cb9dd7.1502 With apologies for cross-posting<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS<br>Special Issue of Energy Research & Social Science: ‘Social Justice, Mobility and Energy Demand’<br><br>We are seeking authors who would like to contribute a paper to a journal Special Issue on ‘Social Justice, Mobility & Energy Demand’, to be published in Energy Research & Social Science. We particularly encourage research from international contexts outside of the UK and Europe, including work focused on the ‘global south’ and developing countries, along with Asia or Australasia. [...] Neil Simcock 2015-02-23T12:06:57+00:00 2015-02-23T12:06:57+00:00 Reminder: CFP for Journal Special Issue on 'Social Justice, Mobility & Energy Demand\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd' https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;e7d3deb2.1502 With apologies for cross-posting<br>CALL FOR PAPERS Special Issue of Energy Research & Social Science: ‘Social Justice, Mobility and Energy Demand’ We are seeking authors who would like to contribute a paper to a journal Special Issue on ‘Social Justice, Mobility & Energy Demand’, to be published in Energy Research & Social Science. We particularly encourage research from international contexts outside of the UK and Europe, including work focused on the ‘global south’ and developing countries, along with Asia or Australasia. Papers topics should seek to address questions related to claims about mobility and/or energy rights and needs, policy making [...] Stefan Bouzarovski 2015-02-10T13:56:05+00:00 2015-02-10T13:56:05+00:00 Path creation, global production networks and regional development: Offshore wind in the UK - 16th February 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;586a1b2b.1502 /Apologies for cross-posting/<br><br>The Centre for Urban Energy and Resilience at the School of Environment, Education and Development (University of Manchester) is co-hosting this event with the Geography research seminar series and the Global Production Networks, Labour & Trade Research Group:<br><br>Path creation, global production networks and regional development: Offshore wind in the UK [...] Neil Simcock 2015-02-09T21:55:55+00:00 2015-02-09T21:55:55+00:00 CfP for Journal Special Issue - Social Justice, Mobility & Energy Demand https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;3d79cfbc.1502 CALL FOR PAPERS Special Issue of Energy Research & Social Science: ‘Social Justice, Mobility and Energy Demand’ We are seeking authors who would like to contribute a paper to a journal Special Issue on ‘Social Justice, Mobility & Energy Demand’, to be published in Energy Research & Social Science. We particularly encourage research from international contexts outside of the UK and Europe, including work focused on the ‘global south’ and developing countries, along with Asia or Australasia. Papers topics should seek to address questions related to claims about mobility and/or energy rights and needs, policy making procedures, and distributional outcomes [...] Sergio Tirado-herrero 2015-02-09T15:30:34+00:00 2015-02-09T15:30:34+00:00 CfP RGS-IBG Exeter 2015 - Exploring vulnerabilities in the Anthropocene: the energy-climate nexus https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;fca41bb5.1502 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Royal Geographical Society with IBG Annual Conference, University of Exeter, September 2-4 2015.<br><br>EGWG-sponsored CfP - Exploring vulnerabilities in the Anthropocene: the energy-climate nexus<br><br>Session convenors: Sergio Tirado-Herrero, University of Manchester; Saska Petrova, University of Manchester; Stefan Bouzarovski, University of Manchester.<br><br>This session aims to discuss the notion of vulnerability as an instrument for enhancing our understanding of the risks heralded by the Anthropocene, and to explore alternative avenues for improving the responses to such threats. Departing from definitions of vulnerability in sustainability studies (Turner et al., 2003; Smit and Wandel, 2006; Gallop\ufffd\ufffdn, 2006), it will assess [...] Sergio Tirado-herrero 2015-01-23T10:32:37+00:00 2015-01-23T10:32:37+00:00 RGS-IBG 2015 EGWG CfP: Exploring vulnerabilities in the Anthropocene: the energy-climate nexus https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;3901eae3.1501 Royal Geographical Society with IBG Annual Conference, University of Exeter, 2\ufffd\ufffd-4 September 2015.<br><br>EGWG-sponsored CfP: Exploring vulnerabilities in the Anthropocene: the energy-climate nexus<br><br>Session convenors: Sergio Tirado-Herrero, University of Manchester; Saska Petrova, University of Manchester; Stefan Bouzarovski, University of Manchester.<br><br>This session aims to discuss the notion of vulnerability as an instrument for enhancing our understanding of the risks heralded by the Anthropocene, and to explore alternative avenues for improving the responses to such threats. Departing from definitions of vulnerability in sustainability studies (Turner et al., 2003; Smit and Wandel, 2006; Gallop\ufffd\ufffdn, 2006), it will assess the exposure of disadvantaged [...] Benjamin Christman 2014-12-19T17:51:50+00:00 2014-12-19T17:51:50+00:00 Fw: EAGA Charitable Trust Masters' bursaries on fuel poverty https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;381ca45d.1412 (originally from Eldin Fahmy)<br><br>Apologies for cross posting Benjamin Christman 2014-10-31T15:06:03+00:00 2014-10-31T15:06:03+00:00 Queens Political Review Special Fuel Poverty Edition - Published Today! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;6605826d.1410 Afternoon all,<br><br>Following the fuel poverty research symposium held in Belfast in July this year, a team of eagle-eyed editors and I have been working on a special 'fuel poverty edition' of the QUB student journal, the Queens Political Review. This is composed of a selection of papers based on the presentations from July. And it's been published online today! Many thanks to all of the contributors and the editors. [...] Stefan Bouzarovski 2014-07-21T15:25:50+00:00 2014-07-21T15:25:50+00:00 Lectureship in Human Geography - University of Manchester https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;df27b02d.1407 Dear all,<br><br>We are seeking to appoint a fixed-term (two year) Lecturer in Human Geography at the University of Manchester. The expectation is that this will be an outstanding individual who will enhance our research and teaching profiles, and will complement and extend our existing scholarship in one or more areas of human geography. [...] Ben Anderson 2014-07-11T16:45:55+01:00 2014-07-11T16:45:55+01:00 Vacancy: Senior Research Assistant/Research Fellow (UoS Energy & Climate Change Group) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;eb900460.1407 with apologies for cross-posting<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Senior Research Assistant/Research Fellow<br><br>Energy & Climate Change Group<br><br>Location: Highfield Campus (University of Southampton)<br>Full Time, Fixed Term (until December 29/12/2016)<br>Closing Date: Monday 04 August 2014<br><br>Applications are invited for a Research Fellow position to conduct high quality research funded by the Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council (EPSRC) in the area of infrastructure with special focus on energy and related business models. Under the guidance of the investigators within the Energy and Climate Change (ECCD, www.energy.soton.ac.uk) and Infrastructure Divisions within the Faculty Of Engineering and the Environment, the candidate will take overall [...] Ryan Walker 2014-06-02T12:32:59+01:00 2014-06-02T12:32:59+01:00 2014 Postgraduate & Early Career Fuel Poverty Research Symposium https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;59f7623c.1406 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Dear Colleagues<br><br>You are invited to attend the 2014 Postgraduate and Early Career Fuel Poverty Research Symposium. This will take place on Friday July 18th 2014, at Queen\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds University in Belfast, Northern Ireland, from 9:30 am to 4:30 pm.<br><br>About 20% of households in the UK live in fuel poverty, a state whereby they cannot keep their homes warm at affordable cost. The need to find an effective solution to the problem of fuel poverty has never been more relevant. Research plays a fundamental role in the formation and implementation of affordable warmth strategies. [...] Anne Winther 2014-05-08T11:33:47+01:00 2014-05-08T11:33:47+01:00 FUTURE CONNECTIONS 2014: OUR COMMON WEALTH? Glasgow 6 June https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;6026c179.1405 FUTURE CONNECTIONS 2014: OUR COMMON WEALTH? - Outcomes of Interdisciplinary Research into Sustainability<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd6 June 2014 at University of Strathclyde<br><br>An interdisciplinary conference by and for PhD students and early career researchers located in or interested in sustainability in Scotland<br><br>CALL FOR ABSTRACTS - EXTENDED DEADLINE: Research papers are invited related to the conference theme and any aspect of sustainability from PhD students and early career researchers across all disciplines. [...] Ryan Walker 2014-05-08T08:20:48+01:00 2014-05-08T08:20:48+01:00 Reminder - Deadline for submission of abstracts: 2014 UK & Ireland Postrgraduate Fuel Poverty Research Symposium https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;abb65a1.1405 REMINDER: Deadline for submission of abstracts 17:00 FRIDAY MAY 16TH 2014 Saska Petrova 2014-04-30T11:54:16+01:00 2014-04-30T11:54:16+01:00 Workshop on Energy, austerity, informality: Exploring the everyday politics of urban infrastructure, Manchester, 21 May 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;858de67d.1404 FYI<br><br>Dear all<br><br>The Centre for Urban Resilience and<br>Energy<http://www.seed.manchester.ac.uk/research/centres/cure/> at<br>the University of Manchester is organising a one-day workshop on \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdEnergy,<br>austerity, informality: Exploring the everyday politics of urban<br>infrastructure\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. The workshop will take place in Manchester on the 21st of<br>May 2014.<br><br>The workshop aims to explore the diverse conceptual debates focusing on the<br>nexus of everyday practices and political action in \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdpost-austerity\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd urban<br>areas. We hope to open up the space for interrogating the diverse ways in<br>which spaces of informality play a role not only in terms of ameliorating<br>poverty, but sustaining the rhythms of everyday [...] Ryan Walker 2014-04-16T11:15:01+01:00 2014-04-16T11:15:01+01:00 2nd Call for Papers - 2014 UK & Ireland PG/ECR Fuel Poverty Research Symposium https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;4607d220.1404 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;4607d220.1404">2nd Call for Papers - 2014 UK & Ireland PG/ECR Fuel Poverty Research Symposium </a> Katherine 2014-04-15T13:46:02+01:00 2014-04-15T13:46:02+01:00 Meeting: Energy Transition and Public Health, 16th May, Royal Society of Medicine (London) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENERGY-VULNERABILITY-NET;86b93388.1404 The "Energy transition and public health" conference at the Royal Society of Medicine on 16th May is a key event for those interested in sustainability. The public health implications of energy choices are increasingly a matter of widespread interest. The increasing costs of fuel bills, the debate about achieving a balance between development of the economy as a whole and the welfare of individual households and families, the relation of energy with climate change policies have all been in the news in recent months. [...]
